results.title: Pete's pigs: a journey through an intensive piggery
results.brief_description: Provides comparison between a mechanized piggery and the traditional method of running a piggery, noting the vast improvements in the control of disease and breeding that have come with automation. No other credits.

results.title: 1984 revisited
results.brief_description: Takes elements of Orwell’s “1984” such as “Big Brother” authoritarianism, information banks, torture and “doublespeak”, and examines how they match some of the events of contemporary history.

results.title: Hydrogen power
results.brief_description: Looks at the developments and associated problems of using hydrogen as an alternative fuel indicating that hydrogen-fuelled cars look very favourable for the future. The film also shows the problems (and proposed solutions) for the storage of hydrogen, an alternative ways to produce hydrogen.

results.title: Easy self defence
results.brief_description: Shows how women can defend themselves in various situations if attacked by a male. Re-enacts typical spots where women are attacked - parks, car parks, poorly-lit areas - and then demostrates various types of movements that will de-mobilize the attacker and enable the woman to make a run for it.

results.title: Bulls
results.brief_description: Adaptation of an Alan Marshall story of a young girl’s isolation on a remote dairy farm, set in the late 1930s. Atmospheric, this production adds another dimension to the Marshall piece, although it lacks the “Laurentian” dimension of “Boys and girls”.

results.title: Sunshine man : Changes face of farming
results.brief_description: Examines the development of the Sunshine Harvester by Hugh McKay, and the landmark industrial relations conflict in which he subsequently became involved, leading to the first Basic Wage ruling (1907).
results.description: Examines the development of the Sunshine Harvester by Hugh McKay, and the landmark industrial relations conflict in which he subsequently became involved, leading to the first Basic Wage ruling (1907).

results.title: Technically speaking - career futures for women
results.brief_description: Shows girls working in technical occupations. Indicates the range of jobs available, the prerequisites, work conditions, and attitudes by employers and fellow workers to girls in these jobs. Also shows how parents and teachers have discouraged girls from taking up these occupations.

results.title: Why study insects?
results.brief_description: Focuses on the work undertaken by Australian National Insect Collection in Canberra where insects from all parts of Australia are studied. Explains why it is important to understand the behaviour of insects. The production does not provide descriptions of insects, rather the processing of information.

results.title: A Visit to a ....: a sheep farm, a dairy, an airport, a container port
results.creator_credit: Dell King, Yvonne MacKay, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing programs about two children who visit a dairy farm, a sheep farm, an airport and a container port. Reveals the daily and seasonal life of each venue.
